::Grounded::
"I have nothing against you friend.  And don't worry bout the 
lockdown because i have loaded all systems into my own cerebrum chips 
so i can override it as well. And sahll i have to change the codes so 
the others can too then so be it. You still haven't explained to me 
how your codes will work through my carbon shield.  Yes so it 
htought. And about being assigned to wepons i had no idea, I saw the 
shields being down and nobody doing anything about it so i put them 
up.  So if you want to control shields so be it, i will control the 
weapons.  But before you go sulk away let me transfer my codes so you 
can work with the vines shield.  Or not..." he mumbles the last bit 
as Obfucious began to walk away.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
> ::Obfucious::
>     "Don't be foolish boy.  The shields were repaired before you 
ever began 
> work on them.  You were assigned to work on the weapons which, I 
might add, 
> you never did.  As for my codes not working, I copied your program 
with only 
> one addition.  I made only three codes with the new addition 
because it is 
> for those who were here before I arrived.  And yes I made myself a 
code, I 
> left out the new addition however.  This addition provides for an 
override in 
> case of a lockdown of the ship.  This way only those with the code 
may travel 
> freely during a lockdown and they may begin or end a shutdown."  He 
begins to 
> think to himself about the currant situation.  "Your engineering 
skills are 
> impressive and your ego is enormous."  He turns to the computer and 
with a 
> few quick strokes erases the new program with no way to retrieve it 
except 
> for the copy in his own memory.  "You are obviously more useful 
here."  He 
> manages to get that out with only the slightest hint of sarcasm in 
his voice. 
>  "I'm sure I can find another computer to fiddle with, in a quieter 
place so 
> that I can think at the same time."  He stalks off to a storage 
locker to 
> pick up a few things.
